action.action-desc: Mr. Santos introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to evaluate certain factors for aliens who submit a state sponsored Chinese immigration application or have been employed by the Chinese Communist Party.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Secure our Borders from the CCP Act of 2023.

section.header: Requirement to evaluate certain history for aliens

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary of Homeland Security shall evaluate the factors described in subsection (b) to determine if an individual submitting a covered application has any links, association, employment history, or association with the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China.
The following factors shall be evaluated with respect to a covered application—

paragraph.text: the alien’s employment or previous employment by the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China;
any immediate family relation of the alien who is employed by the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China;
the alien’s participation in educational programs organized or sponsored by the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China;
any grants awarded to an alien by the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China;
any public statements representing or supporting the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China by the alien;
the alien’s voter registration or party affiliation with the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China;
any anti-capitalist or anti-American public statements made by the alien; and
any financial payments or any reimbursements to the alien made by the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, if the Secretary of Homeland Security determines that any of the factors described in subsection (b) exist with respect to a covered application the Secretary shall deny such application.
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an alien found to have lied on a covered application shall be subject to deportation and a fine of $5,000.

paragraph.text: The term covered application means an application submitted for immigration status by an individual as a result of their relationship with—

subparagraph.text: an employer or institution of higher education that receives funding from the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China; or
an immediate family relation that is employed by or is associated with the Chinese Communist Party or the Government of China.

paragraph.text: The term immediate family relation means a mother, father, step-parent, brother, sister, cousin, uncle, or aunt.
